intro: Senecio polymorphus, commonly known as the variable groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Senecio polymorphus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
